title: What are some cool science DIY projects that a high schooler could do? - Quora

response.answer_text: Depends on your interests. You can do many science experiments. Chemistry:Electrolysis. You can actually do this at home. Take 2 pencils, strip a bit of the wood at both ends to expose the graphite lead. Wind wire around one end of both pencils to act as leads. Insert the pencils with non wired end in a glass beaker with solution. Connect the wires to a 9V battery cell. You can use different color pencils for anode and cathode and simple salt solution. You'll see bubbles rising in the water due to electrolysis.Flame tests are always fun. Different chemicals burn with different colors. You could coat matchstick heads in your lab with these chemicals and light them to get colored match flames.BiologyYou could grow a plant unfer different conditions and note the speed.You could grow a plant and try your hand at grafting, budding etcPhysicsYou can combine geography and physics. You could build a replica of a damn or river. Connect a powerful pump to push water out with force. Take the motor out of a toy RC car or buy a 5V DC motor. Connect the DC motor to an LED bulb with wires such that bulb is away from water. Make turbine blades to spin the motor with the water(small spoons attached well enough to withstand force), and see the bulb glow. Alternately make a wind turbine instead if wasting water and electricity and blow air from your mouth.Will be happy to provide schematics if needed for any.
